RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 78. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONE WAY FARRIOR saved ground close to the early pace, started a bid leaving the three eighths pole and entered the far turn at the rail, eased out leaving the turn, came inside the drifting runner-up in mid-stretch and dug in to take over the final strides. SISYPHUS rated close in the three path the first turn, started a four wide bid approaching the five sixteenths pole, took the nod in the three path entering the stretch, drifted past the eighth pole and was caught in the final strides. HAMMER rated a slim lead inside, was met leaving the half mile pole but recovered the advantage approaching the three eighths, gave up the lead at the rail leaving the far turn then flattened the final sixteenth. RAINBOW DAY stalked two deep, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but dropped back toward the quarter and faded through the far turn. CATALINA KID raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. SILVER REDESDALE drifted into the first turn then stalked from the three path, took a brief lead into the backstretch but was met toward the three eighths pole and faded in the four path on the far turn. REV PARKER saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: One Way Farrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,rail turn,eased out 1/8,up final strides

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 9, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GRAND FIBER contested the pace through the backstretch and raced at even terms nearest the rail on the tun, dug in for the nod mid-stretch and determinedly held on. MISCHIEVOUS JESSE exchanged contact with BE BE BOP at the break then dueled for the lead nearing the three eighths pole, contested the edge two deep on the turn and dug in gamely for second while outfinished for the win. The latter exchanged contact with Mischievous Jesse leaving the gate then engaged in close chase, contested near even terms three wide on the turn but was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. BUFFALO SHUFFLE came away a step slow then picked up the chase leaving the chute, rounded the turn about the four path and finished evenly to take third later yards. JAZZ MAN DO broke in the air then gave chase, raced in range of the lead in the three path on the turn but flattened later yards. NO FOOLING DUDE gave close early chase inside but steadied at the rail past the five sixteenths pole and faded through the turn. MACY'S BOY gave chase, raced near the rail into the turn, angled out leaving the turn and could only close the gap. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Buffalo Shuffle
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow break,chased,4p turn,even finish,up 3rd late

ENTRY.NAME: Grand Fiber
ENTRY.COMMENT: contested pace,even terms rail turn,determinedly,held on

ENTRY.NAME: Jazz Man Do
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in air,chased,range 3p turn,flattened later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 120 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THIRSTY ACCOUNTANT veered out across the path of the late breaking Bellafleet then set a pressured pace inside, widened at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled to hold on. CONTINGENCY pressured the pace through the backstretch, dropped back approaching the quarter pole, rounded the turn off the rail but came back to close the gap in late stretch. CAUSETOWIN gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and came along to take third mid-stretch. MIDCENTURY MODERN became a bit edgy in the gate then ducked in at the break, gave close early chase, raced at the rail on the turn, eased outward entering the stretch and flattened stride. P B FOXY was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase, angled out into the turn, left the turn outside and ran evenly in the lane. NOBLE OBSESSION became edgy in the gate, was forced inward and into P B Foxy at the start then gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and flattened in the lane. BELLAFLEET hesitated at the break then saved ground. SOPHIE'S CANDY gave chase outside and rounded the turn about the six path.

ENTRY.NAME: Thirsty Accountant
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered out break,set pressured pace,widened rail turn,held on drv

ENTRY.NAME: Midcentury Modern
ENTRY.COMMENT: edgy gate,ducked in break,close chase,rail turn,flattened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Contingency
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,dropped back 1/4,off rail turn,closed gap late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility)(Races Whe re Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MR CHANCE ROMANCE chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn, dug in for the lead later yards and held on well. TIMMY gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, split horses mid-stretch and finished well at the outside girth of the winner. FROGGY THE GREMLIN gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the five path on the turn then dueled through the stretch and took third later yards. GUN FACTOR chased through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn then flattened in the stretch duel for third. CAJUN FUN gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn, left the turn outside and finished strong. PRIMETIME JET gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn then flattened toward mid-stretch. BIGZ'S CABANA BOY cleared the field and moved to the inside to show the way, rounded the turn at the rail but gave way inside the sixteenth pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Fun
ENTRY.OWNER: Holly Ridge Farm, LLC and Collins, Timothy

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Chance Romance
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,dug in lane,up later yards,held on well

ENTRY.NAME: Bigz's Cabana Boy
ENTRY.COMMENT: cleared field,set pace inside,rail turn,gave way 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 61. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowe d 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SNEAKY LYNK saved ground on the first turn, bid leaving the three eighths pole and took the lead in the three path approaching the head of the lane, drew clear approaching mid-stretch and widened the final sixteenth. APPEALING ROAD stalked from the four path the opening turn, challenged leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the turn off the rail and dug in to take second mid-stretch. WOODSONG'S CASTLE settled back off the rail the first turn, eased out into the backstretch and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and came along to take third later yards. ELLIES AT WINDSOR took over and moved to the inside to rate the pace, dug in to the challenge of Appealing Road leaving the three eighths pole, was met at the rail approaching the eighth pole and weakened in the lane. PEARLY GHOST stalked the pace from the three path the opening turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and weakened inside the eighth pole. JACKYSINTHECASTLE rated close inside on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. WAGER WORTHY rated close off the rail the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but flattened in the four path on the far turn. GLOBAL EMPRESS showed little response and rounded the far turn in the five path. LADY SPARROW saved early ground, proved to be no factor and rounded the far turn about the five path.

ENTRY.NAME: Wager Worthy
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close off rail,chased 3/8,flattened 4p far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Woodsong's Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,eased out 1/2,chased 7/16,3p far turn,along 3rd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 18600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races W here Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RIVER WARRIOR RVF pressured the pace and took the lead past the five sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the turn and held well under steady stretch handling. DE'S CASTLE steadied at the start then gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and dueled for second toward mid-stretch. PINNACLE REEF gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and finished evenly to take third inside the sixteenth pole. JUBA BOUND chased outside, raced in the five path on the turn and flattened in the lane. ONE CANDY CASTLE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and showed little more. REATA'S CASTLE gave chase and rounded the turn in the four path. ABENDEGO was hustled to the lead inside at the half mile pole and showed the way, but was met past the five sixteenths, rounded the turn at the rail and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: River Warrior Rvf
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,up past 5/16,off rail turn,steady handling lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 9 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 9 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUPER RENEE stalked from the four path the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole and raced close off the rail on the far turn, dug in for the lead mid-stretch, dueled briefly clear in later yards and held on. SIDESWIPED raced well off the early pace about the four path, started a bid approaching the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn in the six path, drifted wider leaving the turn, dug in to take second later yards and was gaining on the winner. LACE REVOLUTION raced off the rail the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the three path, eased out leaving the turn, was outfinished in the duel through the stretch but just got up for third. DULCIMER DAME rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and flattened in the lane. FULL MOON LOVER tapered in and stalked two deep, took the nod past the three eighths pole and contested the edge at the rail on the far turn, but was met while flattening stride mid-stretch. COMPLETE SURPRISE rated the early pace inside, was met at the three eighths pole and gave chase from that point, but dropped back at the rail past the quarter and weakened nearing mid-stretch. CAJUN COUSIN rounded the first turn in the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. TUNSTALL raced off the rail the first turn and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Super Renee
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4p,chased 1/2,off rail far turn,up 1/16,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: Full Moon Lover
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Sideswiped
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 4p,bid 7/16,6p far turn,drifted,up 2nd widest

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 68. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since October 9 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SURF CITY GOLD came away awkwardly and was bumped soon afterward, raced off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path, dueled to the front past the eighth pole, raced clear mid-stretch and drew away while kept alert. VOICE OF NOW moved to the inside and rated the pace into the first turn, came under pressure nearing the quarter pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, was met past the eighth pole but held on for second. DANNY'S WINKSTER raced well back two deep the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. DISTANT FIRE rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn and showed little in the lane. MR. CELLULAR ducked out and made contact with Surf City Gold leaving the gate then settled inside, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn, eased outward leaving the turn and flattened stride. SEIZE THE BREEZE stalked three wide the first turn, gave chase past the half mile pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and weakened. MISS YOU AJAX rounded the opening turn about the five path, left the turn outside and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, but weakened in the six path on the far turn. SILVER R rounded the first turn in the six path and showed little response through the backstretch. SAAFEN raced well back about the three path the first turn and showed little. FOR HONOR AND LUCK became fractious in the gate then stalked two deep, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail into the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Surf City Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Gardner Sean and MIH Affiliates LLC

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Dr. & Mrs. Thomas Bowman, Rick Buckley& Joshua Dreiband

ENTRY.NAME: For Honor and Luck
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious in gate,stalked 2d,chased 7/16,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Miss You Ajax
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Rayan and Knoblauch Michelle R
